name: EJ Bowman House B&B

reviews.title: Beautiful gardens, gourmet food, clean rooms, friendly folks
reviews.text: Having stayed here the last six years in a row, the rooms are comforable and clean with TV/DVD, beautifully decorated, and they have A/C. I love all the goodies through out the home, candy, nuts, chocolate, and cookies. The owners are gourmet cooks. You will love the three course hot breakfast each morning. The location is convienent. The owners go the extra mile to make sure you enjoy you stay, they are warm and friendly. The gardens are lovely with flowers and herbs. I enjoyed sitting out in the garden when I could. You will not be disappointed staying here. Make this B&B a priority when you are in the area.

reviews.title: A Superb place to stay!
reviews.text: We were not at all prepared for such an overwhelming experience. When entering the house you feel like visiting a fashionable villa somewhere in Northern Italy.

reviews.title: Stay here for the location & amenities
reviews.text: The hostess, Alice is creating gourmet breakfast consisting of numerous courses and don’t forget to try their locally roasted coffee, (you have to go Europe find similar quality in taste and aroma). It is all served in a stylish dining room by the host Murphy.

reviews.title: What a wonderful B&B
reviews.text: Murphy may seen to be a grumpy old teacher; however, behind the surface you find a very kind and knowable guy which is able to guide you all around Pennsylvania; from the local restaurant “Scooters” a few miles down the road to Frank Lloyd Wright’s house “Falling Water” a few days drive away.

reviews.title: Wonderful B&B in Amish Country!
reviews.text: The house is of course equipped with TV, DVD and high speed wireless internet so you easily follow your favourite stocks or check you mail, even when you are sitting in the wonderful garden.

If you're at breakfast by 9:00AM, the host rings a bell to wake you up. Not a pleasant sound when you're trying to sleep in on your vacation. Also, the host made a comment anytime we did not finish our food, like we were wasting it. Not something you want to hear on your vacation. Floors were creaky and the television in our room was 13 inches...really small.
reviews.title: Early Breakfast

reviews.text: I have to say though that the breakfast food is fabulous and tastes great. The rooms were nice overall. Large selection of CDs and movies for your listening and viewing pleasure. Coffee and hot chocolate maker was available anytime. Heated tiles in the bathroom is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Feel spoiled at EJ Bowman House

reviews.text: Found Alice and EY of EJ Bowman House to be accommodating and thoughtful. Also willing to give recommendations on restaurants and advice on directions on how to best reach our day trip destination. The home is charming, immaculate and inviting. The breakfast that Alice made were delicious. Definately worth the stay if needing a place around the Lancaster/Hershey area. As it's convenient to both.
reviews.title: Excellent Time

reviews.text: This was our first experience at a bed and breakfast. I now never want to stay at a hotel again. The house was beautiful, the owners exceptional, and the gourmet breakfast was beyond words (bring your appetite). We stayed in the suite on the third floor. The room was so beautiful, and I loved falling asleep to the glow of the gas fireplace. Also, the bathroom was spectacular,and included a whirlpool tub, shower, and heated floors. Let me also mention, the suite, and the entire house was very clean. Though, the house is on a busy road, if you read the prior review, you definitely do not need earplugs. Keep in mind many of the inns or B&B's are on busy roads. I would definitely stay at this B&B again.
reviews.title: Oh The Breakfast!!!! Wonderful!!!
Tasteful and Comfortable
reviews.text: Pumpkin spice bread...vanilla poached pears...hazelnut waffles with a chocolate hazelnut whipped cream. Oh my goodness...this was THE MOST wonderful breakfast I have had in years! Dieters Beware - yes, this was one breakfast - save your calories because this one was worth it. My husband and I get away so infrequently so the EJ Bowman house was a real treat, not only was the breakfast sublime, the house was breathtaking and our room super comfortable. The hosts were generous and warm and we felt completely comfortable relaxing in the library and enjoying a glass of wine in the living room in front of the fireplace. We really had a great time and can recommend the E.J. Bowman house!!

reviews.title: A room with a view
reviews.text: Murphy and Alice were wonderful hosts. Murphy should of gone into map making, he definately knows his maps and directions, not to mention his extensive history of the area. Alot of attention was paid to the finer details and I think that is what makes this place quite special. The walls are filled with memories and nik naks which make you feel right at home. The garden is so beautiful, but with such a warmness to it. Our rooms' window overlooked this garden and had a settee underneath the window so we could get the afternoon sun and look out over the view. Breakfast was an absolute delight, and it was like mom calling all the family down for the sitting. I think that this is the type of place you want to go to, if you want that quaint, homecooked type of feel. Alot of time and effort has been put into it to give it that. I think the Piece de Resistance is the 8 bowls of handmade chocolates sitting around the parlor for anyones enjoyment..

reviews.title: a eating treat, wonderful gardens and hosts
reviews.text: Our stay at this lovely B&B was too short, but we enjoyed the time we did have there. Murphey was so helpful and accommodating... also very witty and a wonderful whistle player. The breakfast that Alice served was just delicious, and we highly recommend this B&B to anyone that is looking for one of the best in the Lancaster area. Don't forget to relax in their awesome garden.

reviews.title: Great B&B - Interesting owners
reviews.text: We loved this place - certainly the most decadent B&B I've ever stayed in. Rooms were totally charming with gas fireplaces, comfy beds, and adorable victorian decor. We stayed from Sturday afternoon to Sunday morning & felt very rejuvenated. Due to very wet weather we didn't wander out except to go to dinner; we lounged in the library watching movies from their extensive selection, played backgammon, and had tea and a bottle of wine we'd brought ourselves. The house is beautifully appointed and comfortable.

reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.text: Breakfast was a gorgeous 3-course affair, I am still craving the oatmeal creme brulee concoction we started with.

reviews.title: Beautiful house, quirky proprietor
reviews.text: I'd caution others that the owner is a unique character - arrival requires a very long & slightly pedantic tour of all the facilities - extremely helpful & makes you feel at home, but you must be prepared for a lengthy event.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I just returned from a lovely and too short stay at the EJ Bowman house. Alice welcomed us to the house immediately when we got there and took us on a tour of the house. The house is beautiful and has a lot of character. She showed us all of the little extras - including chocolates, locally made pretzels, just baked cookies, popcorn, sodas, and "medicinals" for the guests' enjoyment. She showed us to our room and it was lovely. We stayed in the Hauck room and it was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in. Everything was very neat and clean and I especially liked the homemade soap in the bathroom. Each room has a journal of guests who stayed in that room and it was really neat to read about people's experiences. They also have an entire library of books, CD's, and DVD's that guests can borrow during their stay (each room has a CD/DVD player).
reviews.title: Great place - we'll be back!

likes.liked: — Alice & Ey, clean & comfortable, a lot of personal touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a very different experience than what we have normally experienced at a B&B. Typically, we've had our own table, or had hours where we could have breakfast between (i.e. show up anytime between 8 and 10). Ey and Alice do it much differently for a unique experience. They have a large table for all the guests and breakfast starts promptly at 9. Once all the guests are seated, Ey serves each guest a hot drink (coffee, tea or hot cocoa). He serves the first dish which I gather is typically a pastry of some sort (we had oatmeal creme brulee with fresh cranberries), then everyone gets juice/water. Then a fruit plate is served (we had strawberries and canteloupe). Finally, the entree - a mix of sweet and savory. We had pumpkin pancakes with whipped cream, toasted pumpkin seeds, fresh syrup, and canadian bacon. It's an interesting experience as all the guests get to know each other, Ey makes for a delightful host as he discusses various topics and sets with mood with CD's of the guests' choosing, and Alice's food is just fantastic. It's not the place to go with a picky eater as Ey and Alice do take personal interest in everyone's enjoyment of every dish.
reviews.title: Over the Top Inn just outside of Lancaster, PA

likes.disliked: — traffic noise from road out front

reviews.title: Exceptional B&B
reviews.text: Be advised that breakfast starts at 9 and didn't finish for us until around 9:45 or 10AM. It's a formal 3 course breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ey and Alice did a wonderful job making recommendations for us and the other guests. They also gave great directions on the most scenic ways to drive the countryside. And, when you check out, they give you a box of homemade chocolate to take with you. Delicious!
reviews.title: Great room, great hospitality, great experience!

reviews.text: Overall, we felt like true guests in their lovely home. We would return anytime to experience this again!
reviews.title: Looking forward to my next stay!

description: As your hosts, the O'Donnells welcome discerning travelers to where good tastes and elegance are at home for you in their circa 1860 Italianate home (big yellow house). 4 deluxe rooms and a suite (with whirlpool), modern conveniences, full homemade breakfasts and a lovely garden offer you the perfect Lancaster getaway with Hershey, Gettysburg and Philadelphia each a simple day trip away.
